question.title: Spring Boot app using AWS Parameter Store does not reflect updated values even after container restart (requires redeployment)
question.body:
I have a Spring Boot application running in a container.
I configured AWS Parameter Store integration using:

/application/env/version/1.0/SPRING_CONFIG_IMPORT = aws:parameterstore:/application/env/version/1.0/

My application reads properties from paths like:

/application/env/version/1.0/PROGRAM_INFO

Issue:
When I update a parameter in AWS Parameter Store, the new value is not reflected in the application even after restarting the container. The only way to see the updated value is by performing a new deployment.

I have not enabled Spring Actuator refresh or used @RefreshScope because I want to avoid adding that dependency.

Questions:

  • Why does the application require a full redeployment to pick up updated values from Parameter Store?

  • Are there any alternatives to achieve dynamic config refresh without Actuator or @RefreshScope?

question_comments.body: your properties aren't loaded in each time you call for a property, that would be a huge waste of resources. It loads your properties when the application is deployed, and re-uses this list every time properties values are requested. I guess you could write your own reader for properties that reads the file each time a property is requested, but seriously, why would you do that?
